      • trace

        public void trace(Point pt,
                  float amt)
        Description copied from interface: IPath
        A continuous function from real values (floats) to Points.

        Maps a given floating point number from 0 to 1 to a given Point along the perimeter of the Path.
        Specified by:
        trace in interface IPath
        Specified by:
        trace in class Path
        Parameters:
        pt - The Point in which the result is stored.
        amt - A number from 0 to 1.

      • trace

        public static void trace(Point pt,
                         Point a,
                         Point b,
                         float amt)
        Interpolates between the line defined by (a.x, a.y) and (b.x, b.y) by the given amount (a value between 0 and 1) and stores the result in the given point.
        Parameters:
        pt - The point in which to store the result
        a - The first point
        b - The second point
        amt - The amount by which to interpolate (a value from 0 to 1)

      • trace

        public static void trace(Point pt,
                         float ax,
                         float ay,
                         float bx,
                         float by,
                         float amt)
        Interpolates between the line defined by (ax, ay) and (bx, by) by the given amount (a value between 0 and 1) and stores the result in the given point.
        Parameters:
        pt - the point
        ax - the x-coordinate of the first point
        ay - the y-coordinate of the first point
        bx - the x-coordinate of the second point
        by - the y-coordinate of the second point
        amt - the amount by which to interpolate (a value from 0 to 1)

      • touches

        public static boolean touches(float ax,
                              float ay,
                              float bx,
                              float by,
                              float x,
                              float y,
                              float intersectRadius)
        Returns true if the line defined by (ax, ay) and (bx, by) comes within the given radius to any point in the line.
        Parameters:
        ax - the x-coordinate of the first point
        ay - the y-coordinate of the second point
        bx - the x-coordinate of the first point
        by - the y-coordinate of the second point
        x - the x of the point
        y - the y of the point
        intersectRadius - the maximum distance that can be considered touching
        Returns:
        true if the point touches the line and false otherwise

        Parameters:

        dy - THe number of pixels to shift the path down.
